objects.name: hexed noodle
objects.description: Android variant of the Windows AppleSeed backdoor used in Operation Cobra Venom in 2019, masquerading as a Korean Internet Security Agency (KISA) mobile security app.

objects.name: appleseed
objects.description: Windows backdoor malware family related to Hexed Noodle.

objects.name: Operation Cobra Venom
objects.description: Threat actor or campaign associated with the use of AppleSeed and Hexed Noodle malware.

objects.name: T1444
objects.description: Masquerade as Legitimate Application - Hexed Noodle masquerades as a KISA mobile security app.

objects.name: T1592.001
objects.description: Gather Victim Host Information - Hexed Noodle beacons contain device hardware information and phone number.

objects.name: T1059.004
objects.description: Unix Shell - Hexed Noodle system commands are executed by passing them to ‘sh -c’.

objects.name: T1204.002
objects.description: User Execution - The user is required to install the Hexed Noodle APK, accept permissions and launch the app.

objects.name: T1402
objects.description: Broadcast Receivers - Hexed Noodle subscribes to BOOT_COMPLETED, MY_PACKAGE_REPLACED, SMS_RECEIVED and PACKAGE_INSTALL broadcasts.

objects.name: T1547
objects.description: Boot Autostart - The Hexed Noodle app starts on receipt of the BOOT_COMPLETED notification.

objects.name: T1406
objects.description: Obfuscated Files or Information - Hexed Noodle configuration is stored in the app as hex encoded strings containing a 16 byte XOR-key prefix.

objects.name: T1560.002
objects.description: Archive Collected Data Via Library - Hexed Noodle data is Zip compressed before encryption using standard libraries.

objects.name: T1005
objects.description: Data from Local System - Hexed Noodle collects SMS messages and certain filesystem documents.

objects.name: T1119
objects.description: Automated Collection - Hexed Noodle regularly scans file and SMS directories for changes to trigger exfiltration.

objects.name: T1412
objects.description: File and Directory Discovery - Hexed Noodle contains a command to list filesystem contents.

objects.name: T1420
objects.description: Capture SMS Messages - Hexed Noodle collects both stored and incoming SMS messages.

objects.name: T1071.001
objects.description: Web Protocols - Hexed Noodle uses HTTP requests for tasking and exfiltration.

objects.name: T1030
objects.description: Data Transfer Size Limits - Hexed Noodle uploads files in chunks of at most 10MB.

objects.name: T1041
objects.description: Exfiltration over C2 Channel - Hexed Noodle exfiltration and tasking are HTTP POST requests to the same server with different parameters.

objects.name: T1532
objects.description: Data Encrypted - Hexed Noodle exfiltrated data is encrypted, prepended with the 16 byte XOR key and Hex encoded.

objects.name: T1582
objects.description: SMS Control - Hexed Noodle enables the operator to send SMS messages from the victim device.

objects.name: dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Plaintext strings from a Hexed Noodle 'classes.dex' file" hash = "a9ff1ebb548f5bba600d38e709ff331749fa9971" strings: $exfil1 = "multipart/form-data; boundary=$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$" $exfil2 = "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"binary\"; filename=\"" $reqFormatAParam1 = /\?m=[a-d]&p1=/ $reqFormatAParam2 = /&p2=[a-c]/ $smsdb = "slist.ldb" condition: 3 of them }

objects.name: CVE-2021-44228
objects.description: Not mentioned in the report.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Hexed Noodle
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. hexed noodle.
